result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Espino

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Espino in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Annie Louk for Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for hearing.  Defense filed motion to suppress physical evidence and requested motion hearing date.  State to file motion response by November 21, 2022.  Defense to notify court if case goes to drug treatment court depending on evaluation.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed.Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence

Defendant Jesus Espino in court with attorney Michael G. Levine, both by zoom.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesus Espino appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense filed motion to extend motion filing deadline.  State does not object.  Case scheduled for hearing.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 9.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br.16.  Court scheduled deadline to file plea forms and any motions by Augut 17, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Extend Motion Filing Deadline.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court in receipt of a request for substitution from defense. Court was informed that the new judge will be Judge Grayson.

Defendant Jesus Espino in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court set the following filing deadlines. State has until June 20th, 2022 to submit any discovery to the defense. Defense has until July 13th, 2022, to file any change of plea or motions. Case adjourned to Branch 17. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Jesus Espino in court with Attorney Michael G. Levine; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Molina. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 1 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/23/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jesus Espino in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesus Espino
Current: 7723 N Pointe Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 04-21-2022)
Prior: 1826 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Adjustment Number: 22A 038706,
Payable Number: 1001315,
Receipt Number: 22RP016259,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/22 @ 1:30p
